Based on the user's preferences and the context of the question, I would recommend the movie "Serving Sara" (2002) to the user.
"Serving Sara" is a romantic comedy film directed by David Wain. The film stars Marley Shelton as serving Sara, Donald Faison as her cousin Jody, Dave Navarro and Carmen Electra respectively as Jody's two boyfriends, and Fisher Stevens as Jody's boss at the coffee shop where Jody works.
The plot of "Serving Sara" revolves around Sara, a young woman who has never really grown up. She has always been fascinated by the world of adults and has often found herself in situations that are simply beyond her grasp.
One day, Sara comes across a man named Jody. Jody is a young man who has never really grown up like Sara. Like Sara, he has always been fascinated by the world of adults and has often found himself in situations that are simply beyond his grasp.
Despite their similarities, Jody and Sara soon realize that they actually have very little in common at all.
As the two young men continue to spend more and more time together over time, they eventually begin to realize that despite how much they may actually have in common after all, there are still actually still quite a number of other things that they actually actually can’t possibly possibly possibly possibly be related to or concerned about at all.
